elements.title: John Foster (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that John Foster, a Boston printer, made an engraving (pictured) of Richard Mather around 1670, the first produced in colonial America?

elements.title: Franz Fischer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the collier Franz Fischer was claimed to have become, in 1916, the first merchant vessel to be sunk by aerial attack but is now thought to have been sunk by a submarine?

elements.title: Old Dartmouth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the territories of Old Dartmouth contained five modern Massachusetts towns and cities, and parts of two others?

elements.title: Luis Alegre Salazar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Luis Alegre Salazar led the translation of the constitution of the Mexican state of Quintana Roo into Maya?

elements.title: MLS Cup 2022 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the most valuable player of MLS Cup 2022, John McCarthy, only played once in the regular season?

elements.title: Hans von Guretzky-Cornitz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that German general Hans von Guretzky-Cornitz was awarded the Pour le Mérite in 1916 after mistakenly announcing the capture of Fort Vaux?

elements.title: Marshfield station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Chicago's Marshfield station had four tracks and three platforms, and involved three branch lines and an interurban?

elements.title: pull-ups (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Guinness World Record for the most consecutive pull-ups is 651 in 87 minutes?
